meanings.definition: A person or thing that commutes.
meanings.sent1: The commutators on the train help people travel to work every day.
meanings.sent2: The bus driver is an essential commutator for many passengers.
meanings.sent3: I wish I had magical commutators that could teleport me to different places instantly.
meanings.sent4: Her bicycle wheels spun like commutators, swiftly carrying her through the city streets.
meanings.sent5: The commutators in the office elevator efficiently move people between floors.

meanings.definition: A device in an electric motor that reverses the direction of current.
meanings.sent1: The commutators in the motor ensure the electricity flows in the right direction.
meanings.sent2: Electricians need to understand how commutators work to fix motor issues.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous robot kept playing with the commutators, causing the motor to go haywire.
meanings.sent4: The commutators acted like traffic cops, directing the electrical current smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Without functioning commutators, the motor would not be able to operate effectively.

meanings.definition: A mathematical operation that changes the order of two elements in a group.
meanings.sent1: In algebra, commutators are used to rearrange terms in equations.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians study commutators to understand group theory better.
meanings.sent3: The math magician performed tricks with commutators, dazzling the audience.
meanings.sent4: The commutators in the equation danced around, swapping numbers effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Understanding commutators is crucial for solving complex mathematical problems.
